data.title: Member Search — WSAB
data.text:
Directory of Washington Broadcasters

The Directory of Washington Broadcasters contains a listing of every service, radio and television station, commercial and noncommercial, licensed to a community in the State of Washington, both members of the Association and nonmembers. WSAB makes every effort to verify the information in this listing and to keep this listing of stations up to date. However, changes occur in management, ownership, programming, location and contact information so frequently that it is inevitable that you might find outdated information. This listing is posted solely for general informational purposes and may not be relied upon as an authoritative source. Stations with changes to submit should contact the WSAB office via email at kshipman@wsab.org.

Stations are listed according to their City of License.

( * ) Indicates Non-Commercial Station.

Last updated: August 1, 2017

Hatfield & Dawson (H&D) is a Washington State consulting engineering firm with a specialized practice in telecommunications and electromagnetic engineering. The principals and associates of the firm have extensive experience in all aspects of this specialized field. The firm performs design work, government-agency and license-application engineering, preparation of specifications. The firm also performs construction supervision, propagation analysis, measurements, testing and operation review of:

Communications and Radio Systems for FM and AM Broadcast

Interference and Electromagnetic Compatibility Issues

Microwave, cellular, PCS and Paging

UHF and VHF Television Systems

Electromagnetic Engineering & Analysis

Non-Ionizing Electromagnetic Radiation Issues

H&D has a long history of innovative use of computational electromagnetics techniques for the design, analysis, testing and implementation of antenna systems. Our experience in medium-wave antennas is unequalled. We have a record of successful work with both conventional and unusual antennas at frequencies to the 1 GHz region. The firm makes extensive use of computer technology to access allocation databases and digitized terrain data, for CAD-system design, and for automated propagation studies. Our clients include private broadcasting companies, telecommunications common carriers, industrial communications users, educational institutions, cable television systems, public transit agencies, cities, counties, states and agencies of the United States and foreign governments.
